node.title: Introduction
node.p: This is the user manual for appname. It's still under construction.

The LaTeX datatool package is able to save databases in its own internal format. Files in this format are difficult to edit, but are by far the fastest way of loading a datatool database in LaTeX. This application provides a gui making it easier to edit these files. It can also import data from csv files and from SQL databases. appname can run in either batch mode (see cli) or gui mode (see gui).

node.title: Batch Mode
node.p: The default invocation of appname will be in batch mode. (Although if you are importing data from a SQL database and you don't specify a password using sqlpassword, you will be prompted for the password.) You can also explicitly set it to batch mode using the batch option.

node.title: Graphical Mode
node.p: To run appname in graphical mode you must invoke it with the gui option.
The gui interface is currently very primitiveIt needs a lot of work on it! and doesn't allow you to do much, but let's test out a figure here (see mainwindow).

You can use the file to create a new database (not yet implemented), load an existing database or import data. To load an existing database, use file.open. To import data from a csv file use file.importcsv. To import data from a SQL database use file.importsql.
